title: Bacteria for beauty: why you need to start thinking about your skin microbiome
text:
You’ve heard of friendly bacteria for your gut, but what about your complexion? Hannah Ebelthite examines the trend for topical probiotics to ‘rewild’ skin...

In recent years, the health world has been abuzz with all things gut friendly: fermented food, probiotic supplements, even microbiome tests. Thanks to gene sequencing, we know nurturing the trillions of microbes that inhabit our gut impacts more than digestion. A healthy microbiome is abundant and diverse in bacteria, and seems to exert a positive effect on our weight, immunity, disease risk, energy levels, mood, even our skin.

Research also links a healthy gut with reduced rates of inflammatory skin conditions, including psoriasis, eczema,...
